title: What is the similarity between community and society? - Quora

response.answer_text: They are both social constructs. Society is made up of many communities. Communities tend to be more homogeneous (Similar economic classes, Similar ethnicities, Similar Races, Similar religious affiliations.) Both have Alphas (leaders) and Betas( the followers). Each group has roles or jobs that must be fulfilled on different levels and to varying degrees. Both my have financial objectives and limitations based on family income, how much a church has raised, or what the state or federal government has provided through taxes. Both need good infrastructure, good lines of communication, and people willing to step up into those roles in order for each to run effectively.

Your “community” can be defined as the group of people you know as individuals — your family, your immediate neighbors, perhaps your co-workers or classmates — the folks you recognize and acknowledge as individuals if you see them on the street or in a restaurant, etc. You might belong to several communities: co-workers, classmates, the clerk at your local hardware store, etc., whose individuality fades when you see them “out of context.” “Society” is made up of those same folks and the members of other communities you never encounter — a community of communities. It is the larger organism which sustains and regulates interactions among the communities which make it up. Ideally, it operates on the same basic rules: freedom of speech, for example, property rights, freedom from violence, etc.
